alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Marshall; Panola (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 3:26PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lafayette, south central Marshall and east central Panola Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 326 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Holly Springs National Forest, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oxford, Water Valley, Holly Springs National Forest, Springdale, Burgess, Tula, Denmark, Laws Hill, Abbeville, Taylor, Altus, Keel, Blackwater, Delay, College Hill Station, College Hill, Spraggins, Lafayette Springs and Yocona. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
